title: Reunion Island’s Tourism office enters into partnership with Roland Garros International Airport
text:
Reunion Island’s Tourism office enters into partnership with Roland Garros International Airport   
Sep 16, 2015 Image via reunion.fr eTN   
Reunion Island Tourism (IRT) and the island’s primary international airport, Roland Garros International, a few days ago put pen to paper to ink a partnership deal, which is aimed to bring more international airlines and flights to Reunion Island. 
Besides sharing data and information relevant to tourism and travel, the partners will now embark to implement an incentive package for airlines already flying to the island while seeking new airlines, in particular from the rest of Europe outside France and the rest of the world to consider launching flights to Reunion Island. 
A positive visa regime, with waivers in place for citizens of South Africa, India, and China, is thought to be a major supporting factor in making this happen. 
The Tourism Federation of Reunion will work with the airport and IRT towards creating an even more welcoming arrival and departure experience for passengers flying to and from Reunion Island by establishing more user-friendly reception desks while at the same time introducing new destination displays, the latter also bringing the Reunion National Parks into the partnership. 
Joint marketing and sales activities will also see the Roland Garros Airport Company join hands with IRT when attending tourism trade fairs, while mutual visibility will be increased on their respective websites, reunion.fr and reunion.airport.fr . 
Seen in the picture are the two Chief Executives of the Roland Garros Airport Company and of Reunion Island Tourism - Mssrs. Jean-Paul Noel on the left and Patrick Serveaux of IRT on the right in the picture. Source: Reunion Island Tourism (IRT)
